assertion: A typical stamen has a long slender stalk called the filament and a terminal generally bilobed structure called the anther.
reason: The proximal end of the filament is attached to the thalamus or the petal of the flower.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: The number and length of stamens are variable in flowers of different species.
reason: A typical angiosperm anther is bilobed with each lobe having two theca.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: Careful observation of each stamen under a dissecting microscope elucidates the range in shape and attachment of anthers in different flowers.
reason: Stamens from ten flowers of different species show large variation in size.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: A typical angiosperm anther is bilobed and dithecous.
reason: Each lobe of the anther has two theca.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: The anther is a four-sided (tetragonal) structure consisting of four microsporangia located at the corners.
reason: The bilobed nature of an anther is very distinct in the transverse section of the anther.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: The microsporangia develop further and become pollen sacs.
reason: Pollen sacs extend longitudinally through the length of an anther and are packed with pollen grains.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: A typical microsporangium in transverse section appears near circular in outline.
reason: The microsporangium is surrounded by four wall layers: epidermis, endothecium, middle layers, and tapetum.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: The outer three wall layers of a microsporangium perform the function of protection and help in dehiscence of anther.
reason: The outer three wall layers are the epidermis, endothecium, and middle layers.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: The tapetum is the innermost wall layer of the microsporangium and nourishes the developing pollen grains.
reason: Cells of the tapetum possess dense cytoplasm and generally have more than one nucleus.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: Tapetal cells generally have more than one nucleus.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: The centre of each microsporangium contains a group of compactly arranged homogenous cells called the sporogenous tissue.
reason: The sporogenous tissue occupies the centre when the anther is young.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: Microspore tetrads are formed by meiotic divisions of the sporogenous tissue.
reason: As the anther develops, the cells of the sporogenous tissue undergo meiotic divisions.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.
